title: Self-organized Criticality, Phase Transitions, Anomaly and the Beauty of Boundaries
description:
Karen talks with Brett, an evolutionary psychologist with an interest in Jordan Peterson’s Maps of Meaning. We discuss self-organized criticality and phase transitions as they relate to Peterson’s idea of anomaly. (Brett told his story to Paul Vanderklay, video here:  https://youtu.be/qNoYNRSnKEA )

The meta-mythology is                         
Life              Paradise                                Establish order
Death.         Paradise Lost                       Encounter anomaly
Rebirth       Paradise Regained               Reemergence into higher order

Is the direction of everything towards higher complexity?

Don’t cling to the order. Cling to the process that updates the order.
Scientists don’t cling to the theories, they cling to the process that updates the theories.

Complexity is 
 Increasing integration
 Simultaneous Differentiation

In art, that maps onto
 Unity
 Variety

When unity is pathologized, it becomes uniformity, static, frozen, w/o potential
When variety is pathologized, it loses categories, becomes boundary less, loses potential.

Constraints, boundaries, limitations increase creativity, potential.
Anomaly is a constraint, a limitation, forces adaptation or defeat.

Gratitude and humility.

Resource List:

Jordan Peterson
Maps of Meaning

Nima Arkani Hamed
The Morality of Fundamental Physics
https://youtu.be/5aAMJNVmdoY 
If your time is limited, go to 20:00 and watch the section on the 
  Two mountains.

Sharon Glotzer Phd on particles and entropy
Start at 5:35 if you don’t want to hear the whole lecture.
https://youtu.be/et5KcmdCXRk?t=335

Julian Barbour on increasing complexity of the universe
https://youtu.be/nOYio-_cmb4

Jeremy on Structure and Flexibility
https://youtu.be/6IfWU3zQRjI
